intro: Pedicularis × affinis, commonly known as the hybrid lousewort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. Its leaves are typically oval and arranged in a basal rosette, and it thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. Pedicularis × affinis is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it forms dense colonies.
